intro: Aperula neesiana, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, white, night-blooming flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with smooth, grey-green bark and opposite, ovate leaves. Its flowers emit a strong fragrance at night, attracting moths for pollination. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in some African cultures.
